DOCUMENT 205
ELECTRONICALLY FILED
7/14/2025 2:10 PM
70-DR-2023-900051.01
CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
AT ALEXANDER CITY
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR )
PLAINTIFF/RESPONDENT )
VS. ) CASE NO. DR-2023-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND )
DEFENDANT/PETITIONER )
MOTION FOR CONTEMPT
Comes now the Plaintiff/Respondent, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and through his
attorney, Dianne James Davis, and files this Motion for Contempt and would state as follows:
1. That at 10:59 am this morning, Defendant’s counsel sent an email that the Defendant
would be coming to pick up the minor child A.K., dob, 05-24-2012, (age 13) at 1:00
pm today for visitation. Copy attached as Exhibit “A”. That at 10:59 am was the
first that Counsel knew the Mother intended to attempt to exercise visitation
with the minor child, A.K.
2. That per the Order of November 6, 2024, the Court received testimony from the
minor child, (A.K.), concerning her current relationship with the Mother and her
reasons for not abiding by the court-ordered visitation as laid out in the divorce
decree. Following the in camera interview, counsel for both Parties, along with the
Court, agreed that proceeding with the show cause hearing was not appropriate at this
time. This Order further ordered reunification of the minor child and mother through
therapy and family dinners.
3. That on June 2, 2025, the Mother has the minor child., B.M. and wanted to keep him
even though it was not her week and an agreement was reached for summer visitation
for ONLY this minor child, not for the minor child, A.K. A copy of the email is
attached as Exhibit B.
4. That the Mother has not made a demand for the minor child, A.K. (age 13) to
come to her house for summer visitation until now and this is the final week of
DOCUMENT 205
summer visitation which was to begin July 13, 2025, for Bennett. That the
Mother is aware the Father is out of town for work and the minor child is staying with
her grandmother.
5. That the Temporary Order entered by this Court on April 14, 2025, modified the
visitation of the minor child, B.M. and ordered family dinners with both children to
resume and the Mother has missed several Sunday dinners with the children.
6. That on June 18, 2025, an Order was entered by this Court that stated: Modification
of child support is held pending final hearing. The Father is expected and remains
ordered to comply with the custody and visitation schedule set forth in the
final order.
7. That by demanding the minor child, A.K. to go to the Mother’s home for summer
visitation will only hurt the relationship that the Mother declares she wishes to fix.
That the Father texted the child immediately upon being contacted by Counsel
regarding visitation with her mother and her response was “No!! Please I’m scared,
why is this starting now. I don’t wanna go I’m gonna have a nervous
breakdown if I have to go”. A copy is attached as Exhibit “C”.
Wherefore, the premises considered, the Father is requesting this Court enter an Order to
deny the mother visitation with A.K. other than the Family Dinners as set out in other orders of
this Court and find her in Contempt for attempting to take the child knowing the Father is out of
town. That the issue of any visitation be addressed at the Final Hearing which is set for
September 11, 2025.
Respectfully submitted on this the 14th day of July, 2025.
/s/Dianne James Davis
Dianne James Davis (DAV007)
Attorney for Plaintiff/Father
107 Main Street
Alexander City, Alabama 35010
(256) 392-3172
(256) 392-3578 (Facsimile)
dianne@diannedavislaw.com

addressed and postage paid in the U.S. Mail on this the 14th day of July, 2025.
Barbara H. Agricola
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, AL 36801
/s/Dianne James Davis
Of Counsel

It appears that Blaine has not been allowing Brittany to exercise visitation with AK but is allowing
Bennett to visit. As you all are aware, the Judge's order was very clear for summer visits, and it is not
optional for Blaine to unilaterally withhold AK. Brittany will be coming today at l:oopm to pick up
AK for her visitation with her mother. Please let us know where AK is currently staying, as glaine is
out of tornm and we are aware she is staying at another person's house. Please let ui kn-ow what
address she is located at. AK will be returned on the zoth along with Bennett unless AK wishes to
return sooner, in which case AK will be returned no sooner than this Wednesday. Thank you.

DOCUMENT 206
From: Darlene Meadows
Sent: Monday, June 2,202512:01 PM
To: Aria Barjis <aria @agricolalaw.com>; Dianne Davis <dianne@diannedavislaw.com>
Cc: Su Jin Carpenter <sui@agricolalaw.com>; Barbara Agricola <barbara@agricolalaw.com>
Subject: RE: Blaine McGregor v Brittany Gilliland
Blaine has advised me that he had asked Brittany if she wanted this week and she told him no
that they were going to follow the order. He asked if she wanted this week as he has work out
of town. When she refused, he had to change his work schedule. Blaine is quite upset that
Brittany has turned everything around as she knew she was to have Bennett home this
morning. She refuses to tell Blaine what home day care she has him in while she is at
work.
Per the Order the first full week of June would begin June 6th.
Even though there was no agreement for Brittany to keep Bennett this week, after talking with
5th.
Blaine, Bennett can stay and return home at 5:00 pm on Friday June Her 2nd week of June
would be Friday, June 20th at 6:00 to Friday, June 27th at 6:00.
Her first week of July would be from Friday, June 27th at 5:00 pm to Friday, July 4th at 5:00
pm.
Her 2nd week of July would be Sunday July 13th at 6:00 pm to Sunday July 20th at 6:00 pm
as Bennett will be at the beach for MK's cheer camp. Blaine has also attempted to discuss
through text about July and MK's cheer camp at the beach, and so far, she has not
replied.
Blaine is also MUST know where Bennett is staying while she works. Brittany knows
where Bennett stays when he is with his father.
Please advise if Brittany is in agreement to these date and to inform where Bennett is staying
during the day or if she would prefer to bring Bennett home today and use today as one of her
summer daysl
Thanks,
Darlene Y Meadows
Legal Assistant to Dianne James Davis
107 Main Street
Alexander City, AL 35010
